definition: actually/place/classifier for houses, small buildings, institutions etc/that which/particle introducing a relative clause or passive/CL:個|个[ge4]
to have/there is/there are/to exist/to be
square/frame/rule/(legal) case/style/character/standard/pattern/(grammar) case/(classical) to obstruct/to hinder/(classical) to arrive/to come/(classical) to investigate/to study exhaustively

sentences.english: In a sentence, a possessive adjective is always used before a noun.
sentences.chinese: 在一個句子裏，所有格形容詞總是位於名詞之前。

sentences.english: Both words are stressed for the possessive.
sentences.chinese: 所有格的兩個單詞都要重讀。

sentences.english: In a sentence, a possessive pronoun is always used after a noun.
sentences.chinese: 在一個句子裏，所有格代名詞總是位於名詞之後。

sentences.english: Possessives are often used in expressions of time.
sentences.chinese: 在時間的表述中，經常用所有格。

sentences.english: Both can be madly in love and possessive.
sentences.chinese: 既可以瘋狂地愛上和所有格。

sentences.english: Possessive Nouns are nouns which show possession.
sentences.chinese: 所有格名詞是表示擁有權的名詞。

sentences.english: The word in parentheses is the subject pronoun for each possessive adjective.
sentences.chinese: 括號內的單詞是每個所有格形容詞的主語代名詞。

definition: countable noun (in grammar of European languages)
